types.section:
{{fr-adj}}

# {{lb|fr|heraldry}} "embraced" on the specified side by sections that extend to the top and bottom of the opposite edges of the shield, dividing it into three sections with a triangle of the [[field]] in the middle (similar to [[chaussé]] or [[chapé]] but with the base of the triangle being the sinister or dexter side rather than the top or bottom)
types.html:
embrassé (feminine embrassée, masculine plural embrassés, feminine plural embrassées)

  1. (heraldry) "embraced" on the specified side by sections that extend to the top and bottom of the opposite edges of the shield, dividing it into three sections with a triangle of the field in the middle (similar to chaussé or chapé but with the base of the triangle being the sinister or dexter side rather than the top or bottom)
trans: "embraced" on the specified side by sections that extend to the top and bottom of the opposite edges of the shield, dividing it into three sections with a triangle of the field in the middle
